answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Andy, 
The digitalization of records and other materials is a fast growing trend that is being adopted by public libraries, schools, universities and government agencies. Most of us are familiar with the end user experience but there are a lot of technicalities involved in setting up the infrastructure for digital libraries.  
A few articles that you may find useful are: 
a)  Using Cloud Services for Library IT Infrastructure- discusses the different types of cloud computing in libraries, assessment criteria with a case study of a library that is transferring services to host servers.  http://journal.code4lib.org/articles/2510 
b)  The Advance of Computing from the Ground to the Cloud- provides the steps that a library would take to manage its computer applications and explains how cloud computing could lower technology costs, and increase competitiveness and reliability.  http://www.librarytechnology.org/ltg-displaytext.pl?RC=14384 
c)  Cloud Computing: A digital Libraries perspective- has a detailed discussion of digital library search engines, the provisions involved and maintenance aspects.  http://bit.ly/iI0SOs 
d)  Software as a Service- provides an extremely helpful overview of the software delivery model (SAAS) that is often used in cloud computing, stating its advantages and applicability for libraries.  http://www.ala.org/ala/mgrps/divs/pla/plapublications/platechnotes/software.pdf 
I hope this is helpful,  
Pooja Varma 
International City/County Management Association 
Knowledge Network Intern 
pvarma@icma.org

author: Andy White
text:
As some materials are now only available in digital format, directly from a publisher rather than a consortium, where will these materials that don't need shelves or drawers live?     I am aware of one Library system that is dedicating one of their servers to this collection and other organizations that are leasing server space.
We are at this fork in the digital road...
Does anyone have experience or opinions they can share?
title: "self serve" or cloud serve?
